events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle on Main Street. They filed an official claim to start the process.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the keywords in the initial report and description.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and serve as their point of contact.
The customer received an acknowledgment email stating that their claim for the vehicle collision has been accepted for review.
The agent requested photos of the damaged car, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos of damages, and quotes from the repair shop.
The claims investigation unit began reviewing the submitted evidence and cross-checked statements from both parties involved.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer was not at fault, and damages were fully documented for the vehicle repair claim.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering all vehicle damage repairs and offered a rental car reimbursement during repairs.
The customer provided positive feedback on how quickly the claim was processed and expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement.
After review, the claim was officially approved to proceed with payment for the auto repairs and rental reimbursement.
The payment covering the car repairs and additional expenses was issued directly to the repair shop and customer.
The claim process was successfully closed after payment, with all parties agreeing that the vehicle is now fully repaired.
All claim documents and communications were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
